content:
X509ChainPolicy Class

In this Article

Represents the chain policy to be applied when building an X509 certificate chain. This class cannot be inherited.

Syntax

Declaration

public sealed class X509ChainPolicy

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • System.Object
  • X509ChainPolicy

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
,
Equals(Object,Object)
,
GetHashCode()
,
GetType()
,
MemberwiseClone()
,
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
,
ToString()

Remarks

Each X509Certificate2 object can have an X509ChainPolicy property that specifies the policy to be used in the verification process. Note that only X509Certificate2 objects can construct an X509ChainPolicy object.

Constructors summary

X509ChainPolicy()

Initializes a new instance of the X509ChainPolicy class.

Properties summary

ApplicationPolicy

Gets a collection of object identifiers (OIDs) specifying which application policies or enhanced key usages (EKUs) the certificate supports.
CertificatePolicy

Gets a collection of object identifiers (OIDs) specifying which certificate policies the certificate supports.
ExtraStore

Represents an additional collection of certificates that can be searched by the chaining engine when validating a certificate chain.
RevocationFlag

Gets or sets values for X509 revocation flags.
RevocationMode

Gets or sets values for X509 certificate revocation mode.
UrlRetrievalTimeout

Gets the time span that elapsed during online revocation verification or downloading the certificate revocation list (CRL).
VerificationFlags

Gets verification flags for the certificate.
VerificationTime

The time that the certificate was verified expressed in local time.

Methods summary

Reset()

Resets the X509ChainPolicy members to their default values.

Constructors

  • X509ChainPolicy()

    Initializes a new instance of the X509ChainPolicy class.

    public X509ChainPolicy ();

Properties

  • ApplicationPolicy

    Gets a collection of object identifiers (OIDs) specifying which application policies or enhanced key usages (EKUs) the certificate supports.

    public System.Security.Cryptography.OidCollection ApplicationPolicy { get; }

    Property Value

    • OidCollection

      An OidCollection object.

    Remarks

    By default, this collection is empty. You can add additional object identifiers (OIDs) to the collection using the following code: 

            X509Chain ch = new X509Chain();
        ch.ChainPolicy.ApplicationPolicy.Add(new Oid("1.2.1.1"));

        X509Chain^ ch = gcnew X509Chain();
    ch->ChainPolicy->ApplicationPolicy->Add(gcnew Oid("1.2.1.1"));

            Dim ch As new X509Chain()
        ch.ChainPolicy.ApplicationPolicy.Add(new Oid("1.2.1.1"))

    Example

    The following example opens the current user's personal certificate store, allows the user to select a certificate, then writes certificate and certificate chain information to the console. The output depends on the certificate you select. 

       //Output chain information of the selected certificate.
   X509Chain ^ ch = gcnew X509Chain;
   ch->Build( certificate );
   Console::WriteLine( "Chain Information" );
   ch->ChainPolicy->RevocationMode = X509RevocationMode::Online;
   Console::WriteLine( "Chain revocation flag: {0}", ch->ChainPolicy->RevocationFlag );
   Console::WriteLine( "Chain revocation mode: {0}", ch->ChainPolicy->RevocationMode );
   Console::WriteLine( "Chain verification flag: {0}", ch->ChainPolicy->VerificationFlags );
   Console::WriteLine( "Chain verification time: {0}", ch->ChainPolicy->VerificationTime );
   Console::WriteLine( "Chain status length: {0}", ch->ChainStatus->Length );
   Console::WriteLine( "Chain application policy count: {0}", ch->ChainPolicy->ApplicationPolicy->Count );
   Console::WriteLine( "Chain certificate policy count: {0} {1}", ch->ChainPolicy->CertificatePolicy->Count, Environment::NewLine );

    		//Output chain information of the selected certificate.
		X509Chain ch = new X509Chain();
		ch.Build (certificate);
		Console.WriteLine ("Chain Information");
		ch.ChainPolicy.RevocationMode = X509RevocationMode.Online;
		Console.WriteLine ("Chain revocation flag: {0}", ch.ChainPolicy.RevocationFlag);
		Console.WriteLine ("Chain revocation mode: {0}", ch.ChainPolicy.RevocationMode);
		Console.WriteLine ("Chain verification flag: {0}", ch.ChainPolicy.VerificationFlags);
		Console.WriteLine ("Chain verification time: {0}", ch.ChainPolicy.VerificationTime);
		Console.WriteLine ("Chain status length: {0}", ch.ChainStatus.Length);
		Console.WriteLine ("Chain application policy count: {0}", ch.ChainPolicy.ApplicationPolicy.Count);
		Console.WriteLine ("Chain certificate policy count: {0} {1}", ch.ChainPolicy.CertificatePolicy.Count, Environment.NewLine);

            'Output chain information of the selected certificate.
        Dim ch As New X509Chain()
        ch.Build(certificate)
        Console.WriteLine("Chain Information")
        ch.ChainPolicy.RevocationMode = X509RevocationMode.Online
        Console.WriteLine("Chain revocation flag: {0}", ch.ChainPolicy.RevocationFlag)
        Console.WriteLine("Chain revocation mode: {0}", ch.ChainPolicy.RevocationMode)
        Console.WriteLine("Chain verification flag: {0}", ch.ChainPolicy.VerificationFlags)
        Console.WriteLine("Chain verification time: {0}", ch.ChainPolicy.VerificationTime)
        Console.WriteLine("Chain status length: {0}", ch.ChainStatus.Length)
        Console.WriteLine("Chain application policy count: {0}", ch.ChainPolicy.ApplicationPolicy.Count)
        Console.WriteLine("Chain certificate policy count: {0} {1}", ch.ChainPolicy.CertificatePolicy.Count, Environment.NewLine)
  • CertificatePolicy

    Gets a collection of object identifiers (OIDs) specifying which certificate policies the certificate supports.

    public System.Security.Cryptography.OidCollection CertificatePolicy { get; }

    Property Value

    • OidCollection

      An OidCollection object.

    Remarks

    By default, this collection is empty. This property is only supported on Windows XP and later operating systems.

    Example

    The following example opens the current user's personal certificate store, allows the user to select a certificate, then writes certificate and certificate chain information to the console. The output depends on the certificate you select. 

       //Output chain information of the selected certificate.
   X509Chain ^ ch = gcnew X509Chain;
   ch->Build( certificate );
   Console::WriteLine( "Chain Information" );
   ch->ChainPolicy->RevocationMode = X509RevocationMode::Online;
   Console::WriteLine( "Chain revocation flag: {0}", ch->ChainPolicy->RevocationFlag );
   Console::WriteLine( "Chain revocation mode: {0}", ch->ChainPolicy->RevocationMode );
   Console::WriteLine( "Chain verification flag: {0}", ch->ChainPolicy->VerificationFlags );
   Console::WriteLine( "Chain verification time: {0}", ch->ChainPolicy->VerificationTime );
   Console::WriteLine( "Chain status length: {0}", ch->ChainStatus->Length );
   Console::WriteLine( "Chain application policy count: {0}", ch->ChainPolicy->ApplicationPolicy->Count );
   Console::WriteLine( "Chain certificate policy count: {0} {1}", ch->ChainPolicy->CertificatePolicy->Count, Environment::NewLine );

    		//Output chain information of the selected certificate.
		X509Chain ch = new X509Chain();
		ch.Build (certificate);
		Console.WriteLine ("Chain Information");
		ch.ChainPolicy.RevocationMode = X509RevocationMode.Online;
		Console.WriteLine ("Chain revocation flag: {0}", ch.ChainPolicy.RevocationFlag);
		Console.WriteLine ("Chain revocation mode: {0}", ch.ChainPolicy.RevocationMode);
		Console.WriteLine ("Chain verification flag: {0}", ch.ChainPolicy.VerificationFlags);
		Console.WriteLine ("Chain verification time: {0}", ch.ChainPolicy.VerificationTime);
		Console.WriteLine ("Chain status length: {0}", ch.ChainStatus.Length);
		Console.WriteLine ("Chain application policy count: {0}", ch.ChainPolicy.ApplicationPolicy.Count);
		Console.WriteLine ("Chain certificate policy count: {0} {1}", ch.ChainPolicy.CertificatePolicy.Count, Environment.NewLine);

            'Output chain information of the selected certificate.
        Dim ch As New X509Chain()
        ch.Build(certificate)
        Console.WriteLine("Chain Information")
        ch.ChainPolicy.RevocationMode = X509RevocationMode.Online
        Console.WriteLine("Chain revocation flag: {0}", ch.ChainPolicy.RevocationFlag)
        Console.WriteLine("Chain revocation mode: {0}", ch.ChainPolicy.RevocationMode)
        Console.WriteLine("Chain verification flag: {0}", ch.ChainPolicy.VerificationFlags)
        Console.WriteLine("Chain verification time: {0}", ch.ChainPolicy.VerificationTime)
        Console.WriteLine("Chain status length: {0}", ch.ChainStatus.Length)
        Console.WriteLine("Chain application policy count: {0}", ch.ChainPolicy.ApplicationPolicy.Count)
        Console.WriteLine("Chain certificate policy count: {0} {1}", ch.ChainPolicy.CertificatePolicy.Count, Environment.NewLine)
  • ExtraStore

    Represents an additional collection of certificates that can be searched by the chaining engine when validating a certificate chain.

    public System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection ExtraStore { get; }

    Property Value

    • X509Certificate2Collection

      An X509Certificate2Collection object.

    Remarks

    Protocols such as Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) and Secure MIME (S/MIME) allow the inclusion of additional certificates for use in validating a certificate chain; these certificates can prove to be useful in the validation process. This property allows these certificates to be passed to the chain validation engine. By default, this collection is empty.

  • RevocationFlag

    Gets or sets values for X509 revocation flags.

    public System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509RevocationFlag RevocationFlag { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • X509RevocationFlag

      An X509RevocationFlag object.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentException

      The X509RevocationFlag value supplied is not a valid flag.

    Remarks

    This property uses values from the X509RevocationFlag enumeration. X509RevocationFlag is the default value.

    Example

    The following example opens the current user's personal certificate store, allows the user to select a certificate, then writes certificate and certificate chain information to the console. The output depends on the certificate you select. 

       //Output chain information of the selected certificate.
   X509Chain ^ ch = gcnew X509Chain;
   ch->Build( certificate );
   Console::WriteLine( "Chain Information" );
   ch->ChainPolicy->RevocationMode = X509RevocationMode::Online;
   Console::WriteLine( "Chain revocation flag: {0}", ch->ChainPolicy->RevocationFlag );
   Console::WriteLine( "Chain revocation mode: {0}", ch->ChainPolicy->RevocationMode );
   Console::WriteLine( "Chain verification flag: {0}", ch->ChainPolicy->VerificationFlags );
   Console::WriteLine( "Chain verification time: {0}", ch->ChainPolicy->VerificationTime );
   Console::WriteLine( "Chain status length: {0}", ch->ChainStatus->Length );
   Console::WriteLine( "Chain application policy count: {0}", ch->ChainPolicy->ApplicationPolicy->Count );
   Console::WriteLine( "Chain certificate policy count: {0} {1}", ch->ChainPolicy->CertificatePolicy->Count, Environment::NewLine );

    		//Output chain information of the selected certificate.
		X509Chain ch = new X509Chain();
		ch.Build (certificate);
		Console.WriteLine ("Chain Information");
		ch.ChainPolicy.RevocationMode = X509RevocationMode.Online;
		Console.WriteLine ("Chain revocation flag: {0}", ch.ChainPolicy.RevocationFlag);
		Console.WriteLine ("Chain revocation mode: {0}", ch.ChainPolicy.RevocationMode);
		Console.WriteLine ("Chain verification flag: {0}", ch.ChainPolicy.VerificationFlags);
		Console.WriteLine ("Chain verification time: {0}", ch.ChainPolicy.VerificationTime);
		Console.WriteLine ("Chain status length: {0}", ch.ChainStatus.Length);
		Console.WriteLine ("Chain application policy count: {0}", ch.ChainPolicy.ApplicationPolicy.Count);
		Console.WriteLine ("Chain certificate policy count: {0} {1}", ch.ChainPolicy.CertificatePolicy.Count, Environment.NewLine);

            'Output chain information of the selected certificate.
        Dim ch As New X509Chain()
        ch.Build(certificate)
        Console.WriteLine("Chain Information")
        ch.ChainPolicy.RevocationMode = X509RevocationMode.Online
        Console.WriteLine("Chain revocation flag: {0}", ch.ChainPolicy.RevocationFlag)
        Console.WriteLine("Chain revocation mode: {0}", ch.ChainPolicy.RevocationMode)
        Console.WriteLine("Chain verification flag: {0}", ch.ChainPolicy.VerificationFlags)
        Console.WriteLine("Chain verification time: {0}", ch.ChainPolicy.VerificationTime)
        Console.WriteLine("Chain status length: {0}", ch.ChainStatus.Length)
        Console.WriteLine("Chain application policy count: {0}", ch.ChainPolicy.ApplicationPolicy.Count)
        Console.WriteLine("Chain certificate policy count: {0} {1}", ch.ChainPolicy.CertificatePolicy.Count, Environment.NewLine)
  • RevocationMode

    Gets or sets values for X509 certificate revocation mode.

    public System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509RevocationMode RevocationMode { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • X509RevocationMode

      An X509RevocationMode object.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentException

      The X509RevocationMode value supplied is not a valid flag.

    Remarks

    This property uses values from the X509RevocationMode enumeration. X509RevocationMode is the default value.

    Example

    The following example opens the current user's personal certificate store, allows the user to select a certificate, then writes certificate and certificate chain information to the console. The output depends on the certificate you select. 

       //Output chain information of the selected certificate.
   X509Chain ^ ch = gcnew X509Chain;
   ch->Build( certificate );
   Console::WriteLine( "Chain Information" );
   ch->ChainPolicy->RevocationMode = X509RevocationMode::Online;
   Console::WriteLine( "Chain revocation flag: {0}", ch->ChainPolicy->RevocationFlag );
   Console::WriteLine( "Chain revocation mode: {0}", ch->ChainPolicy->RevocationMode );
   Console::WriteLine( "Chain verification flag: {0}", ch->ChainPolicy->VerificationFlags );
   Console::WriteLine( "Chain verification time: {0}", ch->ChainPolicy->VerificationTime );
   Console::WriteLine( "Chain status length: {0}", ch->ChainStatus->Length );
   Console::WriteLine( "Chain application policy count: {0}", ch->ChainPolicy->ApplicationPolicy->Count );
   Console::WriteLine( "Chain certificate policy count: {0} {1}", ch->ChainPolicy->CertificatePolicy->Count, Environment::NewLine );

    		//Output chain information of the selected certificate.
		X509Chain ch = new X509Chain();
		ch.Build (certificate);
		Console.WriteLine ("Chain Information");
		ch.ChainPolicy.RevocationMode = X509RevocationMode.Online;
		Console.WriteLine ("Chain revocation flag: {0}", ch.ChainPolicy.RevocationFlag);
		Console.WriteLine ("Chain revocation mode: {0}", ch.ChainPolicy.RevocationMode);
		Console.WriteLine ("Chain verification flag: {0}", ch.ChainPolicy.VerificationFlags);
		Console.WriteLine ("Chain verification time: {0}", ch.ChainPolicy.VerificationTime);
		Console.WriteLine ("Chain status length: {0}", ch.ChainStatus.Length);
		Console.WriteLine ("Chain application policy count: {0}", ch.ChainPolicy.ApplicationPolicy.Count);
		Console.WriteLine ("Chain certificate policy count: {0} {1}", ch.ChainPolicy.CertificatePolicy.Count, Environment.NewLine);

            'Output chain information of the selected certificate.
        Dim ch As New X509Chain()
        ch.Build(certificate)
        Console.WriteLine("Chain Information")
        ch.ChainPolicy.RevocationMode = X509RevocationMode.Online
        Console.WriteLine("Chain revocation flag: {0}", ch.ChainPolicy.RevocationFlag)
        Console.WriteLine("Chain revocation mode: {0}", ch.ChainPolicy.RevocationMode)
        Console.WriteLine("Chain verification flag: {0}", ch.ChainPolicy.VerificationFlags)
        Console.WriteLine("Chain verification time: {0}", ch.ChainPolicy.VerificationTime)
        Console.WriteLine("Chain status length: {0}", ch.ChainStatus.Length)
        Console.WriteLine("Chain application policy count: {0}", ch.ChainPolicy.ApplicationPolicy.Count)
        Console.WriteLine("Chain certificate policy count: {0} {1}", ch.ChainPolicy.CertificatePolicy.Count, Environment.NewLine)
  • UrlRetrievalTimeout

    Gets the time span that elapsed during online revocation verification or downloading the certificate revocation list (CRL).

    public TimeSpan UrlRetrievalTimeout { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • TimeSpan

      A TimeSpan object.

    Remarks

    When using online revocation checking, this property can be used to set the URL retrieval timeout.

  • VerificationFlags

    Gets verification flags for the certificate.

    public System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509VerificationFlags VerificationFlags { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • X509VerificationFlags

      A value from the X509VerificationFlags enumeration.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentException

      The X509VerificationFlags value supplied is not a valid flag. X509VerificationFlags is the default value.

    Remarks

    This property returns values from the X509VerificationFlags enumeration.

    Example

    The following example opens the current user's personal certificate store, allows the user to select a certificate, then writes certificate and certificate chain information to the console. The output depends on the certificate you select. 

       //Output chain information of the selected certificate.
   X509Chain ^ ch = gcnew X509Chain;
   ch->Build( certificate );
   Console::WriteLine( "Chain Information" );
   ch->ChainPolicy->RevocationMode = X509RevocationMode::Online;
   Console::WriteLine( "Chain revocation flag: {0}", ch->ChainPolicy->RevocationFlag );
   Console::WriteLine( "Chain revocation mode: {0}", ch->ChainPolicy->RevocationMode );
   Console::WriteLine( "Chain verification flag: {0}", ch->ChainPolicy->VerificationFlags );
   Console::WriteLine( "Chain verification time: {0}", ch->ChainPolicy->VerificationTime );
   Console::WriteLine( "Chain status length: {0}", ch->ChainStatus->Length );
   Console::WriteLine( "Chain application policy count: {0}", ch->ChainPolicy->ApplicationPolicy->Count );
   Console::WriteLine( "Chain certificate policy count: {0} {1}", ch->ChainPolicy->CertificatePolicy->Count, Environment::NewLine );

    		//Output chain information of the selected certificate.
		X509Chain ch = new X509Chain();
		ch.Build (certificate);
		Console.WriteLine ("Chain Information");
		ch.ChainPolicy.RevocationMode = X509RevocationMode.Online;
		Console.WriteLine ("Chain revocation flag: {0}", ch.ChainPolicy.RevocationFlag);
		Console.WriteLine ("Chain revocation mode: {0}", ch.ChainPolicy.RevocationMode);
		Console.WriteLine ("Chain verification flag: {0}", ch.ChainPolicy.VerificationFlags);
		Console.WriteLine ("Chain verification time: {0}", ch.ChainPolicy.VerificationTime);
		Console.WriteLine ("Chain status length: {0}", ch.ChainStatus.Length);
		Console.WriteLine ("Chain application policy count: {0}", ch.ChainPolicy.ApplicationPolicy.Count);
		Console.WriteLine ("Chain certificate policy count: {0} {1}", ch.ChainPolicy.CertificatePolicy.Count, Environment.NewLine);

            'Output chain information of the selected certificate.
        Dim ch As New X509Chain()
        ch.Build(certificate)
        Console.WriteLine("Chain Information")
        ch.ChainPolicy.RevocationMode = X509RevocationMode.Online
        Console.WriteLine("Chain revocation flag: {0}", ch.ChainPolicy.RevocationFlag)
        Console.WriteLine("Chain revocation mode: {0}", ch.ChainPolicy.RevocationMode)
        Console.WriteLine("Chain verification flag: {0}", ch.ChainPolicy.VerificationFlags)
        Console.WriteLine("Chain verification time: {0}", ch.ChainPolicy.VerificationTime)
        Console.WriteLine("Chain status length: {0}", ch.ChainStatus.Length)
        Console.WriteLine("Chain application policy count: {0}", ch.ChainPolicy.ApplicationPolicy.Count)
        Console.WriteLine("Chain certificate policy count: {0} {1}", ch.ChainPolicy.CertificatePolicy.Count, Environment.NewLine)
  • VerificationTime

    The time that the certificate was verified expressed in local time.

    public DateTime VerificationTime { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • DateTime

      A DateTime object.

    Remarks

    This property returns a value indicating the time the certificate was validated, expressed in local time. This is important when validating signed messages, since the signature must have been valid at the time of signing, not at the time of validation.

    Example

    The following example opens the current user's personal certificate store, allows the user to select a certificate, then writes certificate and certificate chain information to the console. The output depends on the certificate you select. 

       //Output chain information of the selected certificate.
   X509Chain ^ ch = gcnew X509Chain;
   ch->Build( certificate );
   Console::WriteLine( "Chain Information" );
   ch->ChainPolicy->RevocationMode = X509RevocationMode::Online;
   Console::WriteLine( "Chain revocation flag: {0}", ch->ChainPolicy->RevocationFlag );
   Console::WriteLine( "Chain revocation mode: {0}", ch->ChainPolicy->RevocationMode );
   Console::WriteLine( "Chain verification flag: {0}", ch->ChainPolicy->VerificationFlags );
   Console::WriteLine( "Chain verification time: {0}", ch->ChainPolicy->VerificationTime );
   Console::WriteLine( "Chain status length: {0}", ch->ChainStatus->Length );
   Console::WriteLine( "Chain application policy count: {0}", ch->ChainPolicy->ApplicationPolicy->Count );
   Console::WriteLine( "Chain certificate policy count: {0} {1}", ch->ChainPolicy->CertificatePolicy->Count, Environment::NewLine );

    		//Output chain information of the selected certificate.
		X509Chain ch = new X509Chain();
		ch.Build (certificate);
		Console.WriteLine ("Chain Information");
		ch.ChainPolicy.RevocationMode = X509RevocationMode.Online;
		Console.WriteLine ("Chain revocation flag: {0}", ch.ChainPolicy.RevocationFlag);
		Console.WriteLine ("Chain revocation mode: {0}", ch.ChainPolicy.RevocationMode);
		Console.WriteLine ("Chain verification flag: {0}", ch.ChainPolicy.VerificationFlags);
		Console.WriteLine ("Chain verification time: {0}", ch.ChainPolicy.VerificationTime);
		Console.WriteLine ("Chain status length: {0}", ch.ChainStatus.Length);
		Console.WriteLine ("Chain application policy count: {0}", ch.ChainPolicy.ApplicationPolicy.Count);
		Console.WriteLine ("Chain certificate policy count: {0} {1}", ch.ChainPolicy.CertificatePolicy.Count, Environment.NewLine);

            'Output chain information of the selected certificate.
        Dim ch As New X509Chain()
        ch.Build(certificate)
        Console.WriteLine("Chain Information")
        ch.ChainPolicy.RevocationMode = X509RevocationMode.Online
        Console.WriteLine("Chain revocation flag: {0}", ch.ChainPolicy.RevocationFlag)
        Console.WriteLine("Chain revocation mode: {0}", ch.ChainPolicy.RevocationMode)
        Console.WriteLine("Chain verification flag: {0}", ch.ChainPolicy.VerificationFlags)
        Console.WriteLine("Chain verification time: {0}", ch.ChainPolicy.VerificationTime)
        Console.WriteLine("Chain status length: {0}", ch.ChainStatus.Length)
        Console.WriteLine("Chain application policy count: {0}", ch.ChainPolicy.ApplicationPolicy.Count)
        Console.WriteLine("Chain certificate policy count: {0} {1}", ch.ChainPolicy.CertificatePolicy.Count, Environment.NewLine)

Methods

  • Reset()

    Resets the X509ChainPolicy members to their default values.

    public void Reset ();

    Remarks

    Resets all class properties to their default values.

rawMetadata.title: X509ChainPolicy class | Microsoft Docs
rawMetadata.description: Represents the chain policy to be applied when building an X509 certificate chain. This class cannot be inherited.
